Definition: Area of land devoted to growing crops for consumption, export, and industrial use. Does not include pastures.
Flooded lands are areas that are consistently inundated with fresh, brackish, and salt water. These can be used to represent land loss from sea level rise.
Area of land covered in primary forest (e.g., old growth)
Area of land covered in secondary forest, including plantations
Area of unmanaged grasslands, including native praries, steppe, and avanna.
Other land use categories, including permanent snow and glaciers, barren land, sand dunes, etc.
Pastures are managed grasslands used for grazing. They are
Area of land devoted to urban/suburban development. Assume no emissions from land use (primary emissions captured elsewhere).
Shrublands, including  and chapparal; lands with some sequestration but without uses for forestry or grazing.
